body.p:
Louisville K.y. Septr 5th 1861.
Hon B. Magoffin.
Dr Sir.

About a year ago or a little over Mrs Berling wife of Henry Berling who is now at my office Informs me her Husband sent a Petition asking the remission of a fine of $50:00 assessed against him in the city court For selling Liquor to a slave & that you respited the collection of the fine for one year which has expired, She begs me to pray you to look at the Petition now & remit the fine.
Her husband has sometime since closed his coffee house & is at work as a day laborer & that they are wholy unable to pay the Fine:
I know Berling He is an Industrious clever German, poor, & has a family of small children. He is worthy of your clemency.

Very Truly yours.
Geo. W. Johnston:
